title: How to Find the Area of a Parallelogram

steps.title: Write down the formula A = b h {\displaystyle A=bh} .
steps.content: Write down the formula A = b h {\displaystyle A=bh} . A {\displaystyle A} stands for the area, b {\displaystyle b} stands for the length of your parallelogram, and h {\displaystyle h} stands for the height of your parallelogram. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Locate the base of the parallelogram.
steps.content: Locate the base of the parallelogram. The base is the length of the bottom side of the parallelogram. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Locate the height of the parallelogram.
steps.content: Locate the height of the parallelogram. The height is the length that a perpendicular line must travel from the bottom to the top of the parallelogram. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Multiply the base and the height together.
steps.content: Multiply the base and the height together. [4] X Research source
